channel.title: Hidden Admin Rank
channel.description: Hi im wanting to know how i would make a hidden admin rank and like a hidden owner.

item.title: Hidden Admin Rank
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower

[quote=“jmood128, post:5, topic:392713”]I think on just about all 317 servers, un less someone changed the rights in it. When you have a rank of 4 in playerRight in the players character file…[/quote]Certain PI’s don’t have for some reason. Mine doesn’t have either.

item.title: Hidden Admin Rank
item.dc:creator: @DannyBoy1995 DannyBoy1995
item.description:
@DannyBoy1995 wrote:

[quote=“Ddragonimp, post:2, topic:392713”]Delta scape Solution - 317

playerRights = 4;

same rights as owner… but hidden… another way is to just make a adminFile

	public boolean isAdmin() {

		if (checkLog("admin", playerName)) {
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}
	public boolean isMod() {
		if (checkLog("mods", playerName)) {
			return true;
		}
		if (checkLog("admin", playerName)) {
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}

now instead of using playerRights >= 3
make it check the file to see if there name is in the file…
so the line will be

&& isAdmin()) {

instead of

&& playerRights >= 3){

the file will be located in the config directory although you will have to create admin.txt
and mods.txt just put your name in it.[/quote]
im sorry i forgot to say what base i am using. im using PI

Read full topic

item.title: Hidden Admin Rank
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

Delta scape Solution - 317

playerRights = 4;

same rights as owner… but hidden… another way is to just make a adminFile

	public boolean isAdmin() {

		if (checkLog("admin", playerName)) {
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}
	public boolean isMod() {
		if (checkLog("mods", playerName)) {
			return true;
		}
		if (checkLog("admin", playerName)) {
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}

now instead of using playerRights >= 3
make it check the file to see if there name is in the file…
so the line will be

&& isAdmin()) {

instead of

&& playerRights >= 3){

the file will be located in the config directory although you will have to create admin.txt
and mods.txt just put your name in it.

Read full topic
